headline: Paralympics: Nigeria’s Iyiazi wins shot put bronze
summarized_story:
Eucharia Iyiazi on Thursday increased Team Nigeria’s medals haul at the ongoing 2020 Paralympic Games in Tokyo by winning a bronze medal in the women’s seated shot put event.
In the final of the event’s F57 class at the Olympic Stadium, Iyiazi had a season best throw of 10.40 metres to finish third and claim the bronze medal.
Algeria’s Safia Djelal, who is the world and Paralympic record-holder in the F56 class of the event, created a new world record in the F57 with 11.29m to win the gold medal.
China’s Xu Milan heaved 10.81m to finish second and win the silver medal.
Read AlsoIyiazi’s victory took Nigeria’s medals tally at the Games to three gold, one silver and four bronze medals.

headline: Agric expert, Aubee raises alarm, says 3.4 bn people suffer hunger, malnutrition, and obesity
summarized_story:

“Even with the global rise in hunger and malnutrition, about 33-40 per cent of the food produced in agro-industrial chains is still wasted in production, transport or thrown away.

headline: Shortly After Sacking By Buhari, Former Nigerian Power Minister, Mamman Collapses, Rushed To Hospital—Report

headline: Nigeria’s Iyiazi wins shot put bronze to increase country’s medals haul at Tokyo Paralympic to eight
summarized_story:
Nigeria’s Eucharia Iyiazi on Thursday won bronze medal in women’s shot put at the ongoing 2020 Paralympic Games in Tokyo bring the country’s medal haul to eight.
In the final of the event’s F57 class at the Olympic Stadium, Iyiazi had a season best throw of 10.40 metres to finish third and claim the bronze medal.
Algeria’s Safia Djelal, who is the world and Paralympic record-holder in the F56 class of the event, created a new world record in the F57 with 11.29m to win the gold medal.
China’s Xu Milan heaved 10.81m to finish second and win the silver medal.
Iyiazi’s victory took Nigeria’s medals tally at the Games to three gold, one silver and four bronze medals.

headline: Troops Kill 6 ISWAP Terrorists, Recover Weapons

He described the claim of weak performance as speculation from those who have been analysing matters, stressing the fact that the President said he had reviewed the performance of the cabinet and he needed to reinvigorate for the last run.
“It was by no means a red card on their performance; no, he didn’t say that in that speech.”

headline: 73 Students Abducted From Zamfara School – Police
summarized_story:
Police authorities in Zamfara have confirmed the abduction of 73 Students of Government Day Secondary School in Kaya in Maradun Local Government Area of the state.
The spokesman for the command, Mohammed Shehu, confirmed the number of students abducted in a statement on Wednesday.
“The abduction followed the invasion of the school by a large number of armed bandits that occurred today (Wednesday) at exactly 1122hrs,” he said.
Sources in the village had told Channels Television that the assailants invaded the school in a large number and left with the students to an undisclosed location.
A total of 317 students were abducted from the Government Girls Science Secondary School in Jangebe during an attack in February, six months before bandits kidnapped at least 20 persons comprising students and officials from the College of Agriculture and Animal Science, Bakura.

headline: APC expels Yola South LGA Caretaker Chairman, Sulaiman Adamu -
summarized_story:
The All Progressives Congress (APC) Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) has ratified the expulsion of the Party’s Caretaker Chairman of Yola South Local Government Area, Adamawa State, Sulaiman Adamu.
According to a statement issued and signed on Thursday by John James Akpanudoedehe, the party’s National SecretaryCaretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC), his expulsion from the party takes immediate effect.
Senator Akpanudoedehe said the decision is part of the resolutions reached at the 16th meeting of the CECPC held at the Party’s National Secretariat, Buhari House in Abuja on Wednesday, September 1, 2021.
Recall the viral video in which Alhaji Sulaiman Adamu made unwholesome utterances on President Muhammadu Buhari, the Leader of the Party.
The CECPC calls on party members to always demonstrate self-discipline and restraint by desisting from acts and utterances that are inimical to the interest of the party.

headline: Nigeria: Labour Threatens Industrial Action Over ‘Electricity Tariff Hike’
summarized_story:

In the letter, NLC dismissed reports of an on-going plan to increase electricity tariff as mere speculation.

headline: New York City Mayor Declares State of Emergency after Record-breaking Rain
summarized_story:
New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio declared a state of emergency on Wednesday night due to what he called a “historic weather event” with record-breaking rain across the city leading to flooding and dangerous conditions on the roads.
Nearly all New York City subway lines were suspended late on Wednesday as the remnants of Tropical Storm Ida brought drenching rain and the threat of flash floods and tornadoes to parts of the northern mid-Atlantic, CNN reported earlier.
Earlier in the night, New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy also declared a state of emergency in response to Ida.
New York City also experienced flooding, with social media images showing water gushing over subway platforms and trains.
The New York City mayor urged people to not go outside.
